reviewText: I felt a bit disappointed in this film I saw no fun in it and the action was lame, story line also got a little boring after awhile expected more in the quality of the fight scenes
Title: Book and Sword

reviewText: This is the first of two DVDs that attempt to bring Louis Cha's novel "The Book & The Sword" to the 'big' screen.  It probably does it as well as could be done, but as it is hard to capture the nuances of such a complicated book, the director and screen writers have settled for some rather flashy martial arts action.
Title: Book and Sword

reviewText: If you can get past some wire-fu sequences this movie isn't half bad.  The martial arts action is what you'd expect from movies nowadays.  This appears to be a compilation of a TV series, although I can't be sure.  In the end the story is somewhat fulfilling and it's a good way to spend a couple hours.
Title: Book and Sword

reviewerName: Jed Rutherford "Toda e Nada...Shut Up n Train..."
reviewText: ...adequately sustains interest, and many reasonably choreographed fight scenes... one of those you'll dust off and watch again every 18 months or so on those boring afternoons when you can't be bothered getting into a book...
Title: Book and Sword

reviewText: Vincent Zhao is up there with Jet Li in the martial arts.  This is the first movie in the series of I think two films. Both movies were great. I still think they are TV movies. This has some excellent fights..
Title: Book and Sword
